content: Singaporean politician **Goh Hanyan**[a] (born 16 December 1985) is a Singaporean politician who was elected as a [Member of the Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) in the [2025 general election](/wiki/2025_Singaporean_general_election). She represents the [Nee Soon Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Nee_Soon_Group_Representation_Constituency) as a member of the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party). ## Education Goh had a master’s degree in engineering management at [Columbia University](/wiki/Columbia_University) in 2009. ## Civil career After graduating, Goh worked at [Economic Development Board](/wiki/Economic_Development_Board) (EDB) and spent her last three years at EDB at its [Washington](/wiki/Washington,_D.C.) office. In 2016, she returned to Singapore. Goh later work under the Prime Minister’s Office in the economy and sustainability strategy group. In 2023, she joined the [Ministry of Digital Development and Information](/wiki/Ministry_of_Digital_Development_and_Information) (MDDI) as a director in the Smart Nation Strategy Office and the national AI group for policy and strategy. In March 2025, Goh resigned from her position from 3 April 2025. There was controversy over her appearance at a Meet-the-People session at Holland-Bukit Timah constituency on 17 March 2025 because of the Holland-Bukit Timah GRC self-renewal, before moving over to Nee Soon GRC and to replace Faishal Ibrahim who is moving over to Marine Parade-Braddell Heights GRC. ## Notes [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)Preceded by[K. Shanmugam](/wiki/K._Shanmugam) [Derrick Goh](/wiki/Derrick_Goh) [Carrie Tan](/wiki/Carrie_Tan) [Louis Ng](/wiki/Louis_Ng) [Muhammad Faishal Ibrahim](/wiki/Muhammad_Faishal_Ibrahim) **Member of Parliament for [Nee Soon GRC](/wiki/Nee_Soon_Group_Representation_Constituency)** 2025–present Served alongside: **(2025–present): [K. Shanmugam](/wiki/K._Shanmugam), [Syed Harun Alhabsyi](/wiki/Syed_Harun_Alhabsyi), [Lee Hui Ying](/wiki/Lee_Hui_Ying), [Jackson Lam](/wiki/Jackson_Lam)****Incumbent** This article about a politician from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Goh Hanyan
